title: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Basic Safety
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Basic Safety
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Basic Safety 
Standards for Protection Against Dangers Arising from Medical Exposure to 
Ionising Radiation) (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 2025. 

(2) The citation “the European Union (Basic Safety Standards for Protection 
Against Dangers Arising from Medical Exposure to Ionising Radiation) 
Regulations 2018 to 2025” includes these Regulations.

heading: 3. Regulation 8(5) of the Principal Regulations is substituted by the
text_raw:
3. Regulation 8(5) of the Principal Regulations is substituted by the 

following: 

“(5) An undertaking shall ensure that, in the case of a medical radiological 
procedure on an asymptomatic individual, performed for the early detection of 
disease— 

(a) 

the procedure - 

(i) 

is part of a health screening programme, or 

(ii) 

that 
requires specific documented 
individual by the practitioner, in consultation with the 
referrer, in accordance with guidelines published by the 
Authority in accordance with paragraph (6), and 

justification 

for 

(b) 

special attention is given to the provision of information to the 
individual, as required by paragraph (13).”. 

1 OJ No. L 13, 17.1.2014, p. 1. 
2 OJ No. L 72, 17.3.2016, p. 69. 
3 OJ No. L 152, 11.6.2019, p. 128. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in

title: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Basic Safety
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the European Union (Basic Safety Standards for 
Protection Against Dangers Arising from Medical Exposure to Ionising 
Radiation) Regulations 2018. 

This amendment makes more explicit the requirement to comply with guidelines 
published by the Health Information and Quality Authority when making a 
justification for a medical radiological procedure on an 
documented 
asymptomatic individual, performed for the early detection of disease, and with 
being in accord with guidelines. 

These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Basic Safety Standards 
for Protection Against Dangers Arising from Medical Exposure to Ionising 
Radiation) (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 [280] 5
